intro: Corydalis cytisiflora subsp. altecristata, commonly known as the Alpine Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It is a member of the Fumariaceae family, characterized by its delicate, often spurred flowers and its climbing or trailing growth habit. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its flowers, which can range in color from pink to purple, are borne in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its beauty and adaptability.
